data.title: William "Bill" H. Lewis
data.text:
William ‚ÄúBill‚Äù H. Lewis, 82, of Lincoln passed away Monday October 30, 2023. He was born April 1, 1941, in North Platte, NE to William G. & Freda (Johnson) Lewis.

Bill worked as an attorney serving as lead counsel for Bryan Hospital for many years. He loved his therapy dogs and served several care centers in the Lincoln community including Tabitha, Clark Jeary, and Community Alternatives NE.

Family members include his wife of 59 years, Judy; daughter, Kathryn Blissmer; son, Brad Lewis; Grandchildren, Elizabeth Bradley Lewis, Keely Elizabeth Blissmer, Riley Thomas Blissmer, Cody Thomas Blissmer, Quinn Christopher Blissmer.

Preceded in death by his parents, son Brian and sister Barbara Merlene Fisher.

Visitation with family greeting friends from 2:00-4:00 PM Sunday November 5, 2023, at Roper & Sons South Lincoln Chapel, 3950 Hohensee Dr.

Funeral service 1:30 PM Monday, November 6, 2023, at Lincoln Berean Church, 6400 S. 70th St.

Private family interment at Lincoln Memorial Park.

Memorials may be directed to Tabitha Hospice, Cedars Home for Children Foundation, or Capital Humane Society.

Share a Memory or Condolence

Share a Memory or Condolence

Judy and family, I am so sorry for your loss. I remember Bill as such a kind and loving man.

‚Äì Gail Ihle

To Judy, Brad and Bill‚Äôs family‚Äîour deepest sympathies to you. We enjoyed seeing you at the Women‚Äôs Basketball games. Our thoughts and prayers are with all of you.

‚Äì Diane and Randy Cecrle

To Judy and Bill‚Äôs family‚Äîour deepest sympathies to you in the loss of Bill. He and I were UNL fraternity brothers. We were a few years apart, but I saw him periodically, and he was always a class act. Our thoughts and prayers are with all of you.

‚Äì Bruce McKeag

I‚Äôm so sorry for your loss. I remember when the house on 42nd street was being built. I lived across the street and was fascinated by all the construction. One day Bill came by the site and scolded me for playing around the house. Bill was a great person and will surely be missed.

‚Äì Scott R. Glen

Brad, so sorry for your loss. Prayers for you & your family.

‚Äì Heather Pavich

Judy‚Ä¶.Dave & I just read about Bill‚Äôs passing & wanted you to know we‚Äôre holding you & your family in our prayers at this time.üôè

‚Äì Tani Stempson
